text: detroit's bankruptcy ruling ballet star
sentenced and awards season kicks off
good afternoon this is the new york
times minute Detroit is now officially
eligible for chapter nine this means the
city can reorganize under court
protection for it's 18 billion dollar
debt but the legal fight is far from
over expect Appeals in the coming weeks
a dancer known for playing the villain
on the bolshoy ballet stage has been
sentenced to six years in jail Pavel
dmitrichenko was convicted of ordering
an acid attack on the company's artistic
director it was said to be motivated by
revenge for denying key roles to his
wife hates me loon and movie awards
season is here the Coen brothers inside
Llewyn Davis received top honors for
Best Picture at last night's gotham
independent film awards best acting
prizes went to Matthew McConaughey and
real arson
